1.title: Job's Prosperity and Testing
1.keyEvent: Satan challenges Job's righteousness; Job loses possessions and children

2.title: Job's Physical Affliction
2.keyEvent: Satan afflicts Job with painful sores; Job's wife urges him to curse God

3.title: Job's Lament
3.keyEvent: Job curses the day of his birth in deep anguish

4.title: Eliphaz's First Speech
4.keyEvent: Eliphaz suggests suffering is due to sin

5.title: Eliphaz's Counsel
5.keyEvent: Eliphaz encourages Job to seek God for restoration

6.title: Job's Response to Eliphaz
6.keyEvent: Job laments his suffering and pleads for relief

7.title: Job's Complaint
7.keyEvent: Job expresses despair over his miserable life

8.title: Bildad's First Speech
8.keyEvent: Bildad asserts that Job's children died due to their sins

9.title: Job on God's Justice
9.keyEvent: Job acknowledges God's power but laments his inability to argue with Him

10.title: Job Questions God
10.keyEvent: Job questions God's purpose in his suffering

11.title: Zophar's First Speech
11.keyEvent: Zophar rebukes Job and urges repentance

12.title: Job's Reply to Friends
12.keyEvent: Job defends his integrity and acknowledges God's sovereignty

13.title: Job's Plea to God
13.keyEvent: Job desires to argue his case directly before God

14.title: The Frailty of Man
14.keyEvent: Job reflects on human mortality and hope beyond death

15.title: Eliphaz's Second Speech
15.keyEvent: Eliphaz accuses Job of arrogance and wickedness

16.title: Job's Lament and Defense
16.keyEvent: Job laments friends' harshness and maintains innocence

17.title: Job's Despair
17.keyEvent: Job expresses hopelessness and longing for death

18.title: Bildad's Second Speech
18.keyEvent: Bildad describes the fate of the wicked, implying Job's guilt

19.title: Job's Declaration of Faith
19.keyEvent: Job laments isolation but affirms hope in a Redeemer

20.title: Zophar's Second Speech
20.keyEvent: Zophar warns of swift destruction for the wicked

21.title: Job on the Prosperity of the Wicked
21.keyEvent: Job observes that the wicked often prosper in life

22.title: Eliphaz's Third Speech
22.keyEvent: Eliphaz accuses Job of secret sins and urges repentance

23.title: Job Seeks God
23.keyEvent: Job longs to present his case before God

24.title: Injustice in the World
24.keyEvent: Job laments the prosperity of the wicked and injustice

25.title: Bildad's Third Speech
25.keyEvent: Bildad emphasizes God's majesty and human insignificance

26.title: Job's Reply to Bildad
26.keyEvent: Job praises God's power over creation

27.title: Job Maintains Integrity
27.keyEvent: Job asserts his innocence and describes the fate of the wicked

28.title: The Wisdom of God
28.keyEvent: Job reflects on the inaccessibility of true wisdom

29.title: Job's Former Blessings
29.keyEvent: Job recalls his past honor and prosperity

30.title: Job's Present Suffering
30.keyEvent: Job describes his current humiliation and pain

31.title: Job's Final Defense
31.keyEvent: Job lists his righteousness and calls for God's judgment

32.title: Elihu's Introduction
32.keyEvent: Elihu is angry and prepares to speak against Job and friends

33.title: Elihu's First Speech
33.keyEvent: Elihu defends God's justice and warns Job

34.title: Elihu on God's Justice
34.keyEvent: Elihu asserts God's fairness and condemns Job's accusations

35.title: Elihu on Human Arrogance
35.keyEvent: Elihu rebukes Job's claim that God ignores human deeds

36.title: Elihu Praises God's Greatness
36.keyEvent: Elihu extols God's power and justice in discipline

37.title: Elihu on God's Majesty
37.keyEvent: Elihu describes God's awesome works in nature

38.title: God's First Speech
38.keyEvent: God questions Job about creation and divine wisdom

39.title: God on Animal Kingdom
39.keyEvent: God describes the wonders of various animals

40.title: God Challenges Job
40.keyEvent: God challenges Job's ability to govern creation

41.title: God Describes Leviathan
41.keyEvent: God describes the mighty Leviathan, symbolizing His power

42.title: Job's Restoration
42.keyEvent: Job repents; God restores his fortunes and blesses him
